task_tree_descriptions.description:
Set options for stereo display, perspective, and fogging (depth cueing).
Opens the Appearance panel at the 3D tab.

Calculate the absolute binding free energy for a noncovalent ligand-receptor complex.
Opens the FEP+ panel.

Display and select results of compound extraction from a PDF file, and import them into Maestro.
Opens the Automated Compound Extraction Results Panel.

Extract molecular structures (compounds) from structure figures in a PDF file for import into Maestro.
Opens the Automated Compound Extraction Panel.

Dock a large number of ligands by training a QSAR model on a subset of the ligands and using the model to score the remaining ligands.
Opens the Batch Glide Screening with Active Learning Panel.

Add a caption to the Workspace. You can set the background, font, and text color as well as type in the caption text.
Opens the New Caption dialog box.

Renumber residues in multiple proteins based on a mapping derived from structural alignment to a template structure.
Opens the Adjust Residue Numbering panel.
<!-- enumerate, adsorbate-->Build chemically reasonable initial adsorbate geometries for all combinations of a set of molecules on a set of surfaces.

Calculate the adsorption energies of molecules on substrates at 0 K and 1 atm, and the adsorption free energy at a range of temperatures and pressures.
Opens the Adsorption Energy Calculations Panel.

Predict CDR loops in an antibody using Prime loop prediction.
Opens the Antibody Loop Modeling Panel.

Align the binding sites (or other structural features) of members of a family of proteins by running a global alignment. The list of atoms to use in a pairwise alignment is generated from the selected residues.
Opens the Align Binding Sites panel.
Translate all entries in the Workspace to align their centers of mass.

Align the Workspace structure so that selected atoms lie on one of the Cartesian axes or planes.
Opens the Align Atoms panel.

Display all distances between a selected atom or atoms in a selected residue and the atoms that are not bonded to it that are within a distance threshold.
Opens the Display All Distances panel.
For protein structures with partial occupancies, display the atoms for all occupancies. The alternate positions are displayed as ghost atoms.

Calculate NMR shieldings for molecules in an amorphous structure, taking into account the immediate environment of each molecule.
Opens the Amorphous NMR Calculations panel.

Calculate the amphiphilic moment of a set of molecules, which must be positively charged.
Opens the Amphiphilic Moment panel.

Evaluate the energy of a structure, and decompose the total energy into its components for visualization using the Prime Energy Visualizer panel.
Opens the Analyze Energy panel.

Create a new antibody database or edit an existing database. Import data to or export data from the database. Antibody databases are used by the Antibody Modeling panel for the purpose of predicting structure. In the Antibody Modeling panel, you can specify which databases are used in the modeling process.
Opens the Antibody Database Management panel.

Humanize an antibody by mutating individual amino acids to variants found in homologous human sequences at the same location. Facilities for importing human homologs, sequence alignment, and applying filters based on variation and other criteria are provided. Once a set of mutation sites of interest has been identified, a residue scan for the set is set up and performed to determine how those changes would change properties such as stability, affinity, and exposed surface area.
Opens the Antibody Humanization: Residue Mutation panel.

Predict the variable loop (CDR) region of an antibody, including the hypervariable loops and the associated framework, by homology modeling.
Opens the Antibody Structure Prediction Panel.

Predict the variable loop (CDR) region of an antibody, including the hypervariable loops and the associated framework. Prediction is performed using homology modeling for both the framework and the loops, where the template structures are drawn from one or more curated databases of antibody structures, derived from the published PDB, or user-supplied. Once an initial model is created, you can repredict a selected CDR loop using the advanced de novo loop prediction facilities of Prime.
Opens the Antibody Prediction panel.

Build a perturbation scheme for FEP calculations on a set of congeneric ligands, and run the job to perform the calculations of the relative binding free energy.
Opens the FEP Mapper panel.

Calculate the change in binding energy of a ligand to a receptor when a ligand functional group is mutated to a different functional groups, using molecular dynamics free-energy perturbation. The functional group must be attached by a single bond to the ligand.
Opens the Ligand Functional Group Mutation by FEP panel.
Rebuild a model system for molecular dynamics simulation after editing the entry that contains the full model system.

Calculate the change in binding energy of a ligand to a receptor when an atom in the ligand is mutated to a different element, preserving the hybridization, using molecular dynamics free-energy perturbation.
Opens the Atom Mutation by FEP panel.

Run a Jaguar batch job with a selected batch script. The batch script can specify a sequence of quantum mechanical calculations.
Opens the Jaguar — Run Batch File panel.

Run quantum mechanical calculations from a set of Jaguar input files.
Opens the Jaguar — Run Input Files panel.

Plot thermodynamic and energetic quantities that are generated from Monte Carlo simulations with MCPRO+
Opens the MCPRO+ Analyze FEP panel.

Calculate the free-energy difference between two structures by Monte Carlo free-energy perturbation.
Opens the MCPRO+ Free-Energy Difference by FEP panel.

Calculate protein-ligand binding affinities for related ligands using Monte Carlo sampling and the Linear Interaction Approximation.
Opens the MCPRO+ Linear Response panel.

Minimize the geometry of a protein, a protein-ligand complex, or a single ligand.
Opens the MCPRO+ Minimization panel.

Perform Monte Carlo sampling.
Opens the MCPRO+ Monte Carlo Sampling panel.

Calculate protein-ligand or ligand free-energy differences between ligand functional groups using Monte Carlo free-energy perturbation.
Opens the MCPRO+ Relative Binding Affinity by FEP panel
Switch from Applications menu to Tasks menu.
Assign bond orders to structures that do not have the correct bond orders, based on a range of factors, including connectivity, bond length, bond angles and dihedral angles.
Assign atom types from the force field to the Workspace atoms.
Assign partial charges to the Workspace atoms using the current force field.

Assign the space group for one or more crystal structures in the project.
Opens the Assign Space Group panel.
Assign secondary structure to a protein, by identifying inter-backbone hydrogen bonds and searching for hydrogen-bonding patterns representing helices and strands.

Color atoms in the Workspace or entries using a color ramp based on a numeric property, such as an energy.
Opens the Atom Energy Coloring panel.

Enumerate compounds based on multiple synthetic routes, with filtering on similarity to a reference compound, on properties, and functional groups.
Opens the Automated Reaction-Based Enumeration panel.

Set up and run a set of optimizations with Jaguar on structures that are reactants, transition states, intermediates, or products in a in a reaction network enumeration, with an optional conformational search.
Opens the Reaction Network Enumeration Profiler Panel.

Generate the lowest energy tautomers or conformers for a set of structures, with optional protonation or deprotonation.
Opens the QM Conformer & Tautomer Predictor panel

Generate QSAR models for a chosen property of a set of compounds, and apply the QSAR model to other compounds, with either traditional QSAR methods or DeepChem deep learning methods.
Opens the AutoQSAR panel.

Run transition state searches in an automated fashion for a provided set of reactant and product structures.
Opens the AutoTS: Perform Calculations panel.

Display a summary of the results of a transition state search, including a diagram of the reaction path, list of structures, and summary of energies.
Opens the AutoTS: View Results panel.

Calculate the weighted average structure from a set of conformers selected in the Project Table.
Opens the Calculate Average Structure panel.

Plot the band structure from a periodic DFT calculation.
Opens the Band Structure Viewer panel.

Calculate the spectrum of an electronic transition between the ground state and the lowest singlet or triplet state, including the vibrational envelope, at multiple temperatures.
Opens the Calculate Band Shape panel.

Calculate energies of beta hydrogen elimination reactions (1,2 elimination) and return product and unoptimized intermediate structures.
Opens the Beta Elimination Reactions Panel.

Run a series of metadynamics MD simulations on a set of binding configurations of a single ligand in a single binding site, to rank the poses and predict the correct binding pose.
Opens the Binding Pose Metadynamics panel.

Replace functional groups on a set of ligands with the corresponding bioisosteres, generating all single replacements.
Opens the Bioisostere Replacement panel.

Calculate conformationally-averaged VCD, ECD, or NMR spectra for a molecule.
Opens the Jaguar Spectroscopy Panel.

Calculate the Boltzmann populations of a set of structures at a specified temperature according to a specified energy property.
Opens the Boltzmann Populations panel.

Calculate the change in energy for dissociating one or more molecules into all possible or restricted combinations of two fragments that come from breaking covalent, non-ring single bonds (homolytic dissociation) or removing ligands from a metal atom.

Generate new ligand structures from a set of aligned ligands by swapping groups whose bonds overlap. The swapping can be done multiple times.
Opens the Breed panel.

Modify atom properties, such as element, atom type, partial charge.
Opens the Build Panel at the Atom Properties tab.
Display the Build toolbar in the main window.

Add molecular fragments to a structure, or place them in the Workspace.
Opens the Build Panel at the Fragments tab.
Display the Fragments toolbar in the main window.
Modify residue properties, such as residue type and residue number. Opens the Build Panel at the Residue Properties tab.
Add a variety of calculated structure-based properties to the selected entries. Opens the Calculate Properties panel.
Calculate the principal moments of inertia and their ratios for the selected entries and store them as entry properties.

Cluster the selected entries in the Project Table, based on a similarity metric derived from fingerprints.
Opens the Canvas Similarity and Clustering panel.

Create and apply self-organizing maps from fingerprints or properties of a set of structures.
Opens the Self-Organizing Map Panel.

Replace the framework region of an antibody CDR structure with one derived from a human source. Identify residues in the vicinity of the resulting framework/hypervariable loop junction that may interfere with the conformation of the CDR loops and which should be examined for back mutation.
Opens the Antibody Humanization: CDR Grafting panel.

Place a dummy atom at the centroid of a set of atoms.
Opens the Centroids panel.
Change Maestro's working directory, using a directory chooser. You can also change the directory in the Commands text box with the changedirectory Maestro command.

Calculate charge mobility from the results of an electron coupling calculation by percolation theory or by a method based on energy disorder.
Opens the Charge Mobility panel.

Clean up the geometry of the Workspace structure by minimizing its energy. By default the OPLS_2005 force field is used. If this does not include the atoms you need to minimize, you can set a preference to use the UFF force field, which covers a wider range of atoms but is slower.
Keyboard shortcut: U.

Perform force-field minimization of structures, both periodic and nonperiodic.
Opens the Clean Up Structures panel.

Analyze the geometrical properties and size distribution of molecular clusters from a trajectory as a function of simulation time.
Opens the Cluster Analysis Panel.

Display plots of surfactant cluster properties as a function of time and cluster compositions
Opens the Cluster Analysis Viewer Panel.
Display atoms in adjacent unit cells ("crystal mates") that are within 10 Å of the current unit cell.
Display atoms in adjacent unit cells ("crystal mates") that are within 4 Å of the current unit cell.
Display atoms in adjacent unit cells ("crystal mates") that are within 6 Å of the current unit cell.
Display atoms in adjacent unit cells ("crystal mates") that are within 8 Å of the current unit cell.
Display all atoms in the 26 unit cells ("crystal mates") that are adjacent to the current unit cell.
Hide atoms in the adjacent unit cells.

Assign force-field parameters to a coarse-grained model and create the Desmond CMS file for running a molecular dynamics simulation with this model.
Opens the Coarse-Grained Force Field Assignment panel.

Build a coarse-grained force field from an all-atom system, by fitting parameters for coarse-grained simulations to reproduce all-atom simulations.
Opens the Coarse-Grained Force Field Builder Panel.

View the results of a coarse-grained forcefield builder calculation.
Opens the Coarse-Grained Force Field Viewer Panel.

Import coarse-grained molecules from the installation that are set up for use with the Martini force field, as project entries. These entries can be used to build coarse-grained systems.
Opens the Import Martini Coarse-Grained Structures panel.

Map atoms to coarse-grained particles given an all-atom system.
Opens the Coarse-Grained Mapping Panel.

Iteratively select groups of atoms in a structure and specify them as coarse-grained particles for molecular dynamics simulations, then generate a project entry with the coarse-grained model.
Opens the Map Atoms to Particles panel.

Sketch a coarse-grained structure using spherical particles that you define, and save it as a project entry.
Opens the Coarse-Grained Sketcher panel.

Color the atoms in the included or selected entries depending on the values of the selected entry property.
Opens the Color by Property panel.
Color the atoms of two conformers, selected in the Project Table, by the distances between corresponding atoms.
Color the selected rows in the Project Table by their relative energy, defined by a MacroModel relative energy property.

Change the coloring of atoms and bonds.
Opens the Atom and Bond Coloring panel.

Combine pre-positioned fragments into a single molecule, optionally using linkers and a core, scoring the results by alignment and GlideScore.
Opens the Combine Fragments panel.

Create and edit aliases for commonly used Maestro commands.
Opens the Command Alias panel.

Edit and replay a Maestro command script.
Opens the Command Script Editor panel.

Compare two sets of structures by title, SMILES, or tautomer, and return the unique or common structures from either or both sets.
Opens the Compare Ligand Files panel.

...
Opens the Complex Bilayer Builder Panel.

Build a single organometallic complex with one or two metal centers, with any geometry from 2-coordinate (linear) to 9-coordinate (tricapped trigonal prismatic).
Opens the Build Single Complex panel.

Enumerate metal complexes defined by a central metal and a specified number of ligands. The ligands can be monodentate, bidentate, or haptic. Complexes can be composed of any combination of ligands of any type.
Opens the Complex Enumeration panel

Eliminate redundant conformers from a set of structures, based on atom distances and energy, and filter the conformers by energy. The MMFF and the OPLS series of force fields with various electrostatic treatments, including GB/SA, can be used.
Opens the Redundant Conformer Elimination panel.

Search for ligand conformations like those found in ligand-receptor complexes, with optional minimization of output structures.
Opens the ConfGen panel.

Configure access to Schrödinger software: install, manage and set up access to licenses; set up and manage access to the hosts used to run the software.
Opens the Configure Schrodinger Software panel.
Open the Workspace Configuration toolbox. Same as clicking the + button on the Workspace Configuration toolbar.

Cluster conformers based on atomic or torsional RMSD of selected atoms, returning files for each cluster or a file of representatives.
Opens the Conformer Cluster panel.

Combine molecules by connecting or fusing atoms.
Opens the Connect and Fuse panel.

Import a series of related protein structures, superimpose those structures, and identify structural elements that repeatedly appear in common locations, such as structurally important waters, ions, and ligands.
Opens the Consensus Visualization panel.

Run a series of MD simulations on a protein over a range of pH values with the continuous constant pH MD method, to determine pKa values for titratable residues.
Opens the Protein Constant pH Simulations Panel.

Display plots of the convergence of the periodic DFT energy with energy cutoff and number of k points.
Opens the Convergence Tests Viewer panel.

Dock and covalently bind ligands to a protein target.
Opens the Covalent Docking panel.

Create simulation cells for a set of structures that do not have periodic boundary conditions.
Opens the Create PBC Panel.

Create a database from a screening run, which can be used in the Hit Analyzer Panel.
Opens the Create Screening Database Panel.

Conformational search for small molecule using CREST
Opens the CREST Panel.

Cross-link two protein chains with a peptide linker connecting the termini. The linker can be composed of one or more monomer unit types, and each monomer unit can be composed of one or more user-specified amino acid types. The requested loop conformers are predicted using either known loop conformers in the curated PDB or using a de novo loop buildup process.
Opens the Crosslink Proteins panel.

Create a crystal structure entirely from text data, such as data found in a publication, for example, or from a 3D structure and information on the unit cell.
Opens the New Crystal Structure panel.

Display an analysis of ligand molecular geometries in terms of known geometries derived from the Cambridge Structural Database (CSD). The deviations of the molecular geometries from those found in the database are plotted in a "bubble plot" to give a visual indication of possible inaccuracies in the geometries.
Opens the CSD - Molecular Geometry Analysis panel.

Perform a conformational search on one or more structures, with a choice of force fields, methods, sampling options, and constraints. Specialized searches are available elsewhere for macrocycles and receptor-ligand complexes. The MMFF and the OPLS series of force fields with various electrostatic treatments, including GB/SA, can be used.
Opens the Conformational Search panel.

Predict possible crystal polymorphs and rank them by their energy.
Opens the Crystal Structure Prediction Panel.

View results from a crystal structure prediction calculation.
Opens the Crystal Structure Prediction Viewer Panel.

Add custom or standard fragment collections to selected positions on a core-containing structure, and enumerate the structures resulting from all possible combinations of fragments at each position.
Opens the Custom R-Group Enumeration panel.

Customize the menus in the main window. You can add, delete, or move items, menus, or submenus, and you can assign shortcut keys and mnemonics.
Opens the Customize Menus panel.

Customize the actions performed in the Workspace by the mouse buttons or other pointing device, according to your hardware. Defaults are provided for several hardware configurations.
Opens the Customize Mouse Actions panel.

Save the current Maestro configuration as a new custom profile, or delete or reset a custom profile. The configuration includes the menus, toolbars, preferences, mouse actions.
Opens the Customize Profiles panel.

Customize the toolbars in the main window, by adding, deleting, or moving buttons or toolbars.
Opens the Customize Toolbars dialog box.

Identify residue mutations that can be carried out to create new cysteine disulfide bonds, or mutations that can break existing cysteine disulfides. Residue pairs that satisfy user-supplied filter criteria are scored using a combination of energy terms, and the best scoring mutations can be selected from an interactive results table.
Opens the Cysteine Mutation panel.

Screen molecules with Glide, Shape, and Fingerprint screening, and combine the results based on standard Z-scores to select the top compounds.
Opens the Data Fusion panel.

Use deep learning methods on large structure sets to generate and apply a QSAR model.
Opens the DeepChem AutoQSAR panel.

Calculate the defect correction energy for the formation energy of a point defect using the zero defect correction and alignment term.
Opens the Defect Correction Panel.

Create point defect structures from perfect crystal supercells and run defect calculations.
Opens the Defect Setup Calculations Panel.

Calculate the heats (enthalpies) of formation and the atomization energies of organic molecules in kcal/mol. The heats of formation are calculated from the atomization energies and the experimental heats of formation of the gaseous atoms from the elements.
Opens the Heat of Formation panel.

Play through a demonstration of some of the basic Maestro features.
Opens the Maestro General Demo #1 panel.

Display a profile of the density along a selected axis, summed for atoms in slabs perpendicular to the axis, or a cross-section of the density perpendicular to the selected axis.
Opens the Density Profile panel.

Deposit molecules on a substrate in successive additions with MD equilibration to build up a layer on the substrate.
Opens the Molecular Deposition panel.

Desposit molecules on a substrate in successive additions with MD equilibration to build up a layer on the substrate.
Opens the Molecular Deposition Panel.
Remove entries from the Project Table selection that have identical titles, retaining only the first instance of each title.

Analyze the results of a metadynamics simulation.
Opens the Metadynamics Analysis panel.

Run a metadynamics simulation on one or more collective variables.
Opens the Metadynamics panel.

Set up and submit jobs that relax a system into a local energy minimum, using a Brownian motion simulation.
Opens the Minimization panel.

Run or restart general-purpose molecular dynamics simulations under a chosen set of conditions. Includes optional relaxation of the model system prior to performing the simulation.
Opens the Molecular Dynamics panel.

Set up a multistage molecular dynamics simulation workflow, consisting of an optional relaxation protocol and an arbitrary number of stages, chosen from minimization, Brownian dynamics, molecular dynamics, simulated annealing, and analysis. The results of each stage are fed into the next stage.
Opens the Multistage Simulation Workflow panel.

Run temperature replica exchange molecular dynamics simulations. You can specify the number of replicas, the temperature range and the temprerature profile.
Opens the Replica Exchange panel.

Run a simulated annealing molecular dynamics simulation. You can specify the number of stages and the duration and temperature for each stage.
Opens the Simulated Annealing panel.

Build candidate geometries for all combinations of desorption of a set of molecules from a set of functionalized surfaces.
Opens the Desorption Enumeration Panel.

Calculate the diffusion coefficient for either a type of atom or a type of molecule from an MD trajectory. The trajectory can be generated for the calculation, or an existing trajectory can be used.
Opens the Diffusion Coefficient panel.

...
Opens the Ionic Conductivity Panel.

Display values of diffusion coefficients and plots of the mean square distance (MSD) against simulation time difference. The fit of the MSD to obtain the diffusion coefficient can be adjusted.
Opens the Diffusion Coefficient Viewer panel.

...
Opens the Ionic Conductivity Viewer Panel.

Digitize curves from an image to produce coordinates of the curve.
Opens the Digitize Curves panel.

Build a randomized multi-component organic mixture of a given composition, either on its own, or on a substrate. The substrate can be a crystal surface, the exterior of a nanoparticle, or the interior of a "container" such as a nanotube. The resulting structure can be prepared for molecular dynamics simulations.
Opens the Disordered System Builder panel.
Display good contacts between hydrophobic atoms of a ligand and hydrophobic residues of a receptor in the Workspace.
Arrange the Workspace entries or surfaces in a rectangular grid of "tiles". See the Tiling Entries help topic for more information.

Select the atoms to display or undisplay in the Workspace.
Opens the Display/Undisplay Atoms panel.

Set options for the Workspace appearance: background color, lighting and materials effects, 3D effects, and special screen effects.
Opens the Appearance panel.
Turn stereo viewing on or off.

Create voids in a system of multiple molecules by randomly deleting molecules. The molecules can be all-atom or coarse-grained.
Opens the Distribute Voids panel

Plot the density of states from a periodic DFT calculation as a function of energy.
Opens the Density of States Viewer panel.

Perform a coordinate scan of one or two coordinates of the same type (distance, angle, or dihedral) on specified structures, with optional constraints and minimization of the rest of the structure. The MMFF and the OPLS series of force fields with various electrostatic treatments, including GB/SA, can be used. Use Tools → Plot Coordinate Scan to view the results.
Opens the Coordinate Scan panel.

Determine the contact angle of solvent droplets on a surface.
Opens the Droplet Contact Analysis Panel.

Plot the results of a droplet contact analysis calculation.
Opens the Droplet Contact Analysis Viewer Panel.

Calculate the force-field energy of a structure at its current geometry. The MMFF and the OPLS series of force fields with various electrostatic treatments, including GB/SA, can be used.
Opens the Current Energy panel.

Copy the Workspace selection onto the clipboard, and copy an image of the Workspace. The clipboard stores the atoms in the selection in Maestro format and SMILES format, and an an image of the Workspace. The SMILES string and the image can be pasted into another application; the atoms can be pasted back into the Workspace. The resolution of the image is the current screen resolution, so if you want a higher resolution, you should use the Save Image panel.
Keyboard shortcut: Ctrl+C (⌘C).
Copy the Workspace selection onto the clipboard as a SMARTS pattern.

Delete the selected atoms from the Workspace and place them on the clipboard. The atoms are added to the clipboard in Maestro format and in SMILES format. You can paste them into the Workspace at a later time, or paste them into another application as SMILES.
Keyboard shortcut: Ctrl+X (⌘X).

Define and edit macros that execute a series of Maestro commands.
Opens the Macros panel.

Paste a structure from the clipboard into the Workspace. The structure can be a SMILES string, a structure from ChemDraw or Isis Draw (Windows) or a set of atoms previously cut or copied from the Workspace.
Keyboard shortcut: Ctrl+V (⌘V).

If the structure is a SMILES string, it is converted into a 2D structure. The 2d structure is added to the project as a new entry, with the SMILES string for the structure as the title. No attempt is made at 3D conversion. You should consider running LigPrep to convert the structure to 3D.

If you paste a set of atoms that were cut or copied from Maestro, they are placed at the coordinates at which they were cut or copied onto the clipboard. You can paste atoms from one Maestro session into another session.
Select all atoms in the Workspace, including undisplayed atoms.
Invert the current atom selection: select the unselected atoms, and deselect the selected atoms.
Select the next residue in the chain, if a single residue is selected.
Clear the Workspace atom selection.
Pick atoms in the Workspace to select the currently chosen structural object.
Select the previous residue in the chain, if a single residue is selected.
Apply stored atom selection 1 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 10 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 2 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 3 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 4 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 5 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 6 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 7 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 8 to the Workspace.
Apply stored atom selection 9 to the Workspace.
Store the current atom selection in location 1.
Store the current atom selection in location 10.
Store the current atom selection in location 2.
Store the current atom selection in location 3.
Store the current atom selection in location 4.
Store the current atom selection in location 5.
Store the current atom selection in location 6.
Store the current atom selection in location 7.
Store the current atom selection in location 8.
Store the current atom selection in location 9.
Select atoms using the Atom Selection dialog box.

Undo the last undoable action. The menu item changes to display the name of the last command executed. When you undo an action, the menu item changes to Redo. Undoing can also be performed with the Undo button on the Edit toolbar.

Calculate strain properties of an orthorhombic system using molecular dynamics simulations. The properties are obtained by fitting, using small changes to the cell dimensions.
Opens the Elastic Constants panel.

Plot the stress derived from the total energy or the stress computed directly, against the deformation, along with the parabolic or linear fit, for the results of an elastic constants calculation. Also display the stress tensor and the correlation coefficient. The panel can display results from either MD or QE calculations of the elastic constants.
Opens the Elastic Constants Results Viewer panel

Analyze the coordination between cations and counterions in molecular dynamics simulations. The coordination can be used to analyze the ion transport characteristics of electrolytes.
Opens the Electrolyte Analysis Calculations Panel.

Display plots of numbers of interactions between ions in electrolyte materials. You can either plot an aggregate distribution of the numbers of coordinated oxygen atoms as a histogram, or you can plot the interaction partners of each cation over time.
Opens the Electrolyte Analysis Viewer Panel.

Simulate pore formation by applying an electric field to membrane systems.
Opens the Electroporation Calculation Panel.

Use the Workspace structure to generate a set of modified structures in which selected atoms have been changed (transmuted) to another element. All possible transmutations are performed on the selected atoms, within defined bounds. The new structures are added to the project.
Opens the Elemental Enumeration panel

Minimize the energy of a set of ligands docked to a receptor with respect to geometry. The MMFF and the OPLS series of force fields with various electrostatic treatments, including GB/SA, can be used.
Opens the Embrace Minimization panel.

Search for conformations of a set of ligands docked to a receptor. The MMFF and the OPLS series of force fields with various electrostatic treatments, including GB/SA, can be used.
Opens the Embrace Conformational Search panel.
Enhance the perception of depth (with ambient spherical occlusion). This option is most useful for large structures.

Calculate and plot enrichment metrics from the results of a virtual screen and a set of known actives.
Opens the Enrichment Calculator panel.

Create binary disordered systems from all possible combinations of two molecule types taken from two sets of structures, with a specified ratio of the number of structures of each type.
Opens the Enumerate Disordered Systems panel.

Enumerate atomic substitutions in a periodic structure to generate new structures, for example with distributions of vacancies or dopants.
Opens the Enumerate Periodic Structures panel

Display results of equation-of-state calculations
Opens the Equation of State Viewer Panel.

Predict the pKa of the ionizable atoms in ligand-sized structures, or generate probable variations in the location and number of protons based upon pKa values and tautomeric preferences.
Opens the Epik panel.

Plot the dielectric function from a Quantum ESPRESSO calculation.
Opens the Dielectric Function Viewer panel

Run a periodic DFT calculation on a slab, with a continuum dielectric medium on either side of the slab. This medium can either represent the vacuum or a pair of metal electrodes of opposite polarity.
Opens the Effective Screening Medium Calculations panel.

Display a plot of the charge density and the potential along the Z-axis through a slab, as evaluated from an effective screening medium (ESM) periodic DFT calculation.
Opens the ESM: Density/Potential Profile panel.

Perform MD simulations to remove solvents from condensed all-atom and coarse-grained systems.
Opens the Evaporation Panel.

Plot the results of an evaporation calculation.
Opens the Evaporation Viewer Panel.

Display information on protein-ligand interactions derived from a molecular dynamics simulation, in graphical form. The diagrams show RMSD and RMSF measures for proteins, including backbone, side-chain, and secondary structure changes; ligands, including internal and external motions; and protein-ligand contacts, including H-bonds, hydrophobic, ionic, and water-bridge contacts.
Opens the Simulation Interactions Diagram panel.

Analyze the content of the excited states of a metal complex in terms of charge transfer to and from metal and ligand atoms.
Opens the Excited State Analysis Panel.

Plot the results of an excited state analysis in terms of the fragments in the complex and charge transfer between the fragments.
Opens the Excited State Analysis Viewer Panel.

Export structures and properties from the Project Table to the SARvision | Biologics interface. Only available on Windows.
Opens the Export to SARvision | Biologics dialog box, then the SARvision | Biologics interface.

Extract dimers or clusters from a set of molecules that are displayed in the Workspace, and write them to a file or add them to the Maestro project. The set of molecules must be part of a Desmond model system.
Opens the Extract Dimers panel.

Analyze the results of FEP calculations generated from an FEP map to produce estimates of the relative free energies for the perturbations and binding free energies for the ligands.
Opens the FEP Mapper Analysis panel.

Evaluate the change in binding free energy on mutation of a protein residue in the presence of a ligand to determine whether the residue is important for ligand selectivity.
Opens the FEP Protein Mutation for Ligand Selectivity panel.

View the results of a FEP+ Protocol Builder job
Opens the FEP+ Protocol Builder Results Viewer Panel.

Set up, run, and analyze FEP calculations for the relative binding affinities of a set of congeneric ligands to a target.
Opens the FEP+ panel.

Generate a set of FEP+ protocols and use machine learning to identify an optimal protocol for the system.
Opens the FEP+ Protocol Builder Panel.

Calculate the change in binding affinity of two proteins or the change in stability of a single protein due to a set of single mutations.

Build a trained scoring model for docking to a particular protein target. Invert the selection: select the unselected entries, and deselect the selected entries.
Deselect all entries in the Project Table.

Select entries on the basis of their properties.
Opens the Entry Selection dialog box.

Randomly select a percentage of the current selected or included entries.
Opens the Random Selection dialog box.

Select entries that match one or more SMARTS patterns.
Opens the Select by SMARTS dialog box.
Set the number of stars for the selected entries to 1.
Set the number of stars for the selected entries to 1.
Set the number of stars for the selected entries to 3.
Set the number of stars for the selected entries to 0.

Change any fixed entries in the entry selection so that they are no longer fixed. The entries remain in the Workspace, but can be removed by actions like Include Only. The padlock icon is removed from the In column for these entries.
Move the selected entries out of their groups to the ungrouped area.
Unlock the selected entries so that they can be modified or deleted. The padlock icon is removed from the Row column for these entries.

Display reports on a variety of protein properties, such as deviations from ideal values, B-factors, and missing atoms.
Opens the Protein Reports panel.

Calculate descriptors for a protein or antibody that can be used for machine learning.
Opens the Calculate Protein Descriptors Panel.

Analyze the interactions at the interface of two proteins, defined as two sets of chains. The analysis locates residues in the second set of chains that are within a given distance of residues in the first set of chains, and presents counts of hydrogen bonds, salt bridges, disulfide bonds, pi-pi stacking interactions, and van der Waals clashes, and reports the van der Waals surface complementarity and buried solvent-accessible surface area.
Opens the Protein Interaction Analysis panel.

Predict the bound conformation for two protein structures. The proteins are held rigid during the docking process. When the process is complete, a rank ordered set of possible poses for the two proteins is returned.
Opens the Protein-Protein Docking panel.

Provide an interactive graphical representation of the reliability of a particular protein structure for modeling, as represented by a variety of physical measures.
Opens the Protein Reliability Report panel.

Analyze the proteins in the Workspace, and display both tabular and graphical reports on their quality, as measured by deviations from ideal values. An interactive 2-D plot area allows you to select elements of the protein on the basis of their deviations from ideality and have those elements selected in the Workspace for further consideration.
Opens the Protein Structure Quality Viewer panel.

Generate and display a titration curve for one or more proteins.
Opens the Protein Titration Curve panel.

Predict the structure of a protein from its sequence by homology modeling, including multimer and GPCR building, and flexibility in choosing templates, editing alignments, and building the structure.
Opens the Structure Prediction panel.

Add properties that are counts of substructures to project entries.
Opens the Add Substructure Count Property Dialog Box.

Change display settings or internal settings of entry properties.
Opens the Change Properties Dialog Box.
Set the column width to the width of the longest data value.
Set the column width to the width of the column heading.
Set the column width to the maximum of the heading width and the width of the longest data value.
Opens the Add Relative Energy Property dialog box
Customize the menus in the Project Table panel. You can add, delete, or move items, menus, or submenus, and you can assign shortcut keys and mnemonics. Opens the Customize Menus panel.
Customize the toolbars in the Project Table panel, by adding, deleting, or moving buttons or toolbars. Opens the Customize Toolbars dialog box.
Select this option if you want to copy the properties of the source entries to the target entries when duplicating entries; deselect it to copy only the structure.
Split the selected entry into a set of entries, one for each chain in the source entry.
Copy the properties of the source entry to the new entries when the source is split.
Split the selected entry into a set of entries, one for each ligand in the source entry, one for the waters, and one for any other atoms, such as a protein.
Split the selected entry into a set of entries, one for each molecule in the source entry.
Export rows and columns from the Project Table to a CSV file, which can be read into a spreadsheet application. Opens the Export Spreadsheet panel.

Export the selected entries in the Project Table panel with their properties directly to a Canvas project, and open the Canvas GUI with that project loaded. Opens the Export to Canvas dialog box to select options for the Canvas project, then a file selector to name or locate the Canvas project.
Show or hide the Find toolbar to find and replace text, in any table cell except the row number.

Import data from a spreadsheet into the project as entry properties. Combined with the use of the Export Spreadsheet dialog box, you can export data to a spreadsheet, manipulate it, and re-import it into Maestro. Opens the Import Spreadsheet panel.
Import surfaces or volumes from a file and associate them with the selected entry. There must be only one entry selected for this menu item to be available. Opens a file selector to choose the files.

Import vibrational data from a Jaguar calculation and associate it with the selected entry. There must be only one entry selected for this menu item to be available. Opens a file selector to choose the file.
Open the Preferences panel at the Project Table – Properties tab, so you can set project-related preferences.
Add a new property column to the project table. Opens the Add Property dialog box, in which you can specify the name, type, and precision of the property and its initial value.

Clear the values in the chosen properties for the selected entries or all entries.
Opens the Clear Property Values Dialog Box.

Copy values from one property to another, for the selected entries or for all entries.
Opens the Copy Property panel.

Create, edit, and delete custom property families.
Opens the Manage Custom Property Families panel.

Set the number of decimal places displayed for one or more real-valued properties. This item is not on the Property shortcut menu if the property does not have real values.
Opens the Set Decimal Places dialog box.

Delete chosen properties.
Opens the Delete Property dialog box
Hide all project properties. Only the Row, In, and Title columns remain visible.

Merge the values of one or more properties into a destination property, by concatenating the source properties into a string in the selected order, with a specified separator.
Opens the Merge Properties panel.
Show only the primary properties of each property family, and hide the secondary properties.

Select the properties to show.
Opens the Show Properties dialog box, in which you can choose the properties to show.
Show only the properties that have values for one or more of the selected entries, and hide all other properties.
Show all project properties.
Show only the Maestro properties.

Display a tree view of the properties in the Project Table, which you can use to show and hide properties and property families, locate and scroll to properties.
Opens the Property Tree panel, which is docked to the right of the properties in the table by default.

Perform Pareto ranking of project entries for 2 to 4 properties. The result is a property that specifies the rank. The entries can be sorted and the top-ranking entries selected after ranking.
Opens the Multivariate Ranking panel.

Recalculate values of entry properties that were generated from the structures.
Opens the Recalculate Molecular Properties Dialog Box.
Change the order that the properties appear in the Project Table. Opens the Reorder Properties dialog box.

Display 2D structures as a third column in the Project Table. Structures with more than a specified number of atoms (default 200) are not displayed. For protein-ligand complexes, the ligand is displayed, with an icon in the top right to indicate that a protein is present.

Sort the entries and entry groups in the Project Table by the values of one or more properties. Entries can be grouped before sorting, and groups can be sorted on the same properties as ungrouped entries or on different properties. Entries with the highest or lowest values can be selected after sorting. The sort can be applied to all entries, or just the selected entries.
Opens the Sort Project Table panel.

Update properties that are counts of substructures of project entries.
Opens the Add Substructure Count Property Dialog Box.

Locate peaks in a plot of intensity against angle from an x-ray powder diffraction experiment, after removing background. Peaks can be detected automatically and adjusted or assigned manually.
Opens the Powder Diffraction Indexing panel.

View structures from Maestro in PyMOL. You can start and stop PyMOL, send structures from Maestro to PyMOL, and make settings for the PyMOL scene and image.
Opens the PyMOL for Maestro panel.

Open a window that can be used to run Python commands, with the Schrödinger environment set up.
Opens the Python Shell panel.

Calculate ADME properties and 2D and 3D QSAR descriptors of small molecules.
Opens the QikProp panel.

Monitor the convergence of QM jobs (Jaguar or Quantum Espresso) while they are running.
Opens the QM Monitor panel

Use quantum mechanically-polarized ligand partial atomic charges and dock ligands to a protein target with Glide.
Opens the QM-Polarized Ligand Docking panel.

Build a 3D QSAR model from a set of aligned ligands, and use the model to predict activities for other molecules. The model can be based on atom types, but not on pharmacophore types.
Opens the Atom-Based QSAR panel.

Perform mixed quantum mechanical/molecular mechanical (QM/MM) calculations on proteins and protein-ligand complexes.
Opens the QSite panel.

Find bonds in a structure by element pair, order, or length, and delete or change the order of selected bonds.
Opens the Query Bonds Panel.

Send a query to Mogul for a set of ligand molecules, to obtain a report on the match between the geometric parameters of the molecules and those found in the Cambridge Structural Database (CSD).
Opens the Query Cambridge Structural Database panel.

Search the local file system for structures that match an ASL expression or contain specified structure properties, and import the results into the project.
Opens the Query Local Materials panel

Query the databases of the Materials Project.
Opens the Query Materials Project Database panel

Identify the groups that are attached to a common core in a series of molecules and display properties of the identified R groups. The core can be taken from CombiGlide attachment bond labeling, specified by a SMARTS pattern, or determined by the maximum common substructure obtained from a Canvas MCS run.
Opens the R-Group Analysis panel.

Create and edit ligands for metal complexes and manage ligand libraries.
Opens the Ligand Creator panel

Create and edit R groups, and manage R-group libraries.
Opens the R-Group Creator panel.

Display a Ramachandran plot of protein phi and psi dihedral angles.
Opens the Ramachandran Plot panel.

Scan the orientations around a ligand bond or view rotamer states of a selected protein residue, and see a breakdown of the energy for each orientation or state. No relaxation of the structure is done during the scan.
Opens the Rapid Torsion Scan panel.

Create a ray trace image of the Workspace, using PyMOL.
Opens a file browser to specify the output file.

Calculate and plot radial distribution functions from a molecular dynamics simulation.
Opens the Radial Distribution Function panel.

Enumerate structures by substitution of R groups in the reactants and products of a single- or multi-step reaction.
Opens the Reaction-Based Enumeration panel

Calculate reaction barriers, enthalpies, and energies of intermediates for a series of related compounds, based on a prototype reaction, which can include multiple transition states and intermediates. The structures for the reactions are enumerated by addition of functional groups to the structures for the prototype reaction.
Opens the Reaction Energetics Enumeration panel.

Display a diagram of the energy for the stationary points in the progress of a reaction, derived from the energies of specified Maestro project entries.
Opens the Reaction Profile Viewer panel

Run a set of optimizations with Jaguar on structures that are reactants, transition states, intermediates, or products in a reaction network, with an optional conformational search.
Opens the Reaction Network Profiler panel.

Prepare input structures for each stage of a reaction network, annotated with the relevant properties. The prepared structures can then be used in the Reaction Network Profiler panel.
Opens the Create Reaction Network Profiler Input Structures panel.

Set up and run a transition state search. The setup involves providing a set of reactant and product structures, viewing the reactant and product complexes and an initial reaction path, adjusting these structures as necessary, then making settings and running the job.
Opens the Transition State Search panel.

View the results of a transition state search.
Opens the Transition State Search Viewer panel.

Identify protein residues that have a propensity for deamidation, oxidation, glycosylation or proteolysis. Residues are identified based on canonical definitions reported in the literature plus filters based on solvent accessibility and b-factor. You can add search defintions using the extensible PROSITE syntax.
Opens the Reactive Protein Residues panel.

Prepare reagent libraries for use in combinatorial screening or combinatorial library enumeration, by identifying the functional group and labeling the attachment bond.
Opens the Reagent Preparation panel.

Redefine the lattice for a crystal structure, by specifying new lattice constants, defining a plane for one face of the new cell, supplying a transformation matrix, or converting to a primitive cell.
Opens the Redefine Lattice panel.

Optimize a docked ligand in the environment of its protein, taking protein flexibility into account. The optimization can be performed using a variety of protocols for both covalently-bound and non-covalently-bound ligands, and can optionally include periodic boundary conditions, an implicit solvent, and an implicit membrane.
Opens the Refine Protein-Ligand Complex panel.

Refine the structure of loops in the protein that is displayed in the Workspace. The refinement can be run with periodic boundary conditions, in implicit solvent, and with an implicit membrane.
Opens the Refine Loops panel.

Remove molecules from a system prepared for MD simulations, by random selection, preserving force-field information.
Opens the Remove Molecules from System Panel.

Rename the property. You can change the visible name and the internal name, and you can also change the property type.
Opens the Edit Property Name/Type dialog box.

Change the representation of atoms and bonds. You can choose the representation and apply it to all atoms or to selected atoms.
Opens the Molecular Representation panel.

Analyze replica exchange simulations. Display plots of temperature replicas as functions of time.
Opens the Replica Exchange Dynamics Review Panel.

Run an analysis of the protein in the Workspace to produce properties of the residues, including hydropathy, energies, solvent-accessible surface areas, and rotatable bonds.
Opens the Residue Analysis panel.

Dispay a heat map of the distances between all pairs of a selected PDB atom type in a protein, and select points in the plot for highlighting and display of the distances in the Workspace.
Opens the Residue Distance map panel.

Perform multiple mutations of a protein to optimize either the binding affinity between sets of protein chains or the stability of the protein. The residues that are candidates for mutation can be chosen using homology modeling to identify variable or conserved residues, solvent-accessible surface area to identify surface residues, distances to identify contacts with other residues, surface shape complementarity, and manual selection.
Opens the Affinity Maturation panel.

Perform a set of amino acid mutations, and for each mutation calculate changes in a variety of properties, including protein stability and protein affinity. You can specify the set of residues for which the scan is performed, and the set of residue changes at each position.
Opens the Residue Scanning panel.

Display the results of residue mutations that are made in the Antibody Humanization: Residue Scanning panel. You can examine changes in various properties, both in a table and in a graph, and you can view mutations in the Workspace.
Opens the Humanize Antibody Viewer panel.

Display the results of residue mutations that are made in the Affinity Maturation panel. You can examine changes in various properties, both in a table and in a graph, and you can view mutations in the Workspace.
Opens the Affinity Maturation Viewer panel.

Display the results of residue mutations that are made in the Residue Scanning panel. You can examine changes in various properties, both in a table and in a graph, and you can view mutations in the Workspace.
Opens the Residue Scanning Viewer panel.

Change ribbon representations and settings. You can choose the style and color scheme, limit the range of residues for which ribbons are displayed, apply, update, or delete ribbons, and set the atoms that are displayed with the ribbons.
Opens the Ribbons panel.

Rotate a set of protein structures (and associated objects) into the frame of reference of a reference structure, using the same rotation for each structure.
Opens the Rotate Structures panel.
Calculate the change in translational, rotational, vibrational, and total entropy of each ligand upon binding to a receptor, using the rigid-rotor harmonic oscillator (RRHO) model.

Create a linear synchronous transit reaction path by interpolation between a reactant structure and a product structure. The path is returned as a set of structures with a property that defines the distance along the path.
Opens the Reaction Path Interpolation panel.

For a given set of reactants, enumerate possible reaction channels for several kinds of reactions, either by choosing specific channels, by random selection, or by exhaustive enumeration.
Opens the Reaction Channel Enumeration panel.

Compute the change in solvent-accessible surface area upon binding for receptor-ligand pairs. The surface areas and their changes on binding are broken down into contributions from pharmacophore types, residue types, and structural features.
Opens the Binding Surface Area Analysis panel.

Save an image of the Workspace to a file in TIFF, JPEG, or PNG format.
Opens the Save Image panel.

Set up and run a job to decompose a set of structures into its constituent scaffolds, or cores.
Opens the Scaffold Decomposition panel.

Tune the range-separation parameter ω in long-range-corrected density functionals so that the ionization potential as calculated from separate DFT calculations is as close to the HOMO orbital energy as possible.
Opens the Tune DFT Range-Separation Parameter Panel.

Add, delete, and export scenes, and make settings for scenes.
Opens the Manage Scenes panel.
Create a new scene, which contains project entries and data as well as the Workspace view.
Start viewing scenes. The Scenes toolbar is displayed below the Workspace.

Specify the location of the OPLS4 custom parameters to be used with the current project.
Opens the Set Custom Parameters Location Dialog Box.

Build one or more complexes from a set of ligands and capping groups, by mapping the coordination sites on the complex to the attachment points on the ligands. The complexes are minimized using a force field.
Opens the Sculpt Complex panel.
Select residues that have backbone dihedrals that are in the disallowed region.
Select residues that have side-chain dihedrals that are in the disallowed region.

Select the top Glide poses from the selected project entries or a file.
Opens the Select Top Poses panel.

Build a semicrystalline polymer, consisting of crystalline and amorphous layers.
Opens the Semicrystalline Polymer Builder panel.

Set up and run a semiempirical NDDO quantum chemical calculation on one or more structures, including geometry optimization, property evaluation, and generation of property surfaces.
Opens the Semiempirical NDDO Module panel.

Manage sets of atoms that are used in Maestro operations,such as selecting atoms in the Workspace.
Opens the Manage Sets panel.

Add repulsive barriers to a system displayed in the Workspace, and save the updated system containing barrier information as a Desmond Model.
Opens the Set Barrier Potential for MD Panel.

Analyze the output from a Desmond simulation and display the results of the analysis in various forms.
Opens the Simulation Event Analysis panel.

Display various measures of the quality of a simulation, and plot various quantities as a function of simulation time.
Opens the Simulation Quality Analysis panel.
Display or undisplay entry information in the Workspace for a single "target" entry, subject to the related preference.

Find, visualize and characterize protein binding sites. Identify druggable sites, characterize hydrophobic and hydrophilic regions in the site, and classify hydrogen-bond donor, acceptor, and metal-binding regions. Provide global binding site characteristics, including measures of exposure and overall hydrophobicity and hydrophilicity.
Opens the SiteMap panel.

Draw and edit structures in 2D, then save them either as 2D structures, or convert to 3D with LigPrep.
Opens the 2D Workspace panel.

Generate and display a 2D diagram of the interactions between a ligand and various protein residues.
Opens the Ligand Interaction Diagram panel.

Evaluate a SMARTS pattern in the Workspace and identify the SMARTS atom index of atoms that you pick in the Workspace.
Opens the SMARTS Index panel.

Refine a set of atom groups by SMARTS patterns for use in coarse-grained modeling, and run a job to locate and label the atom groups in a set of structures.
Opens the Define Groups by SMARTS panel.

Study the evolution of the solid electrolyte interphase using cycles of reaction-template based molecular dynamics simulations.
Opens the Solid Electrolyte Interphase (SEI) Calculation Panel.

Plot the results of a solid electrolyte interphase calculation, view the evolution of species and their density over the course of the simulation.
Opens the Solid Electrolyte Interphase (SEI) Viewer Panel.

Build a large solvated system around solutes or on a substrate. The resulting structure can be prepared for molecular dynamics simulations.
Opens the Solvation Builder Panel.

Cluster the selected entries in the Project Table panel by the spectral method.
Opens the Spectral Clustering panel.

Plot UV/Visible, IR/Raman, phonon, VCD, ECD, and NMR spectra from information on line positions and intensities, as generated by Jaguar or Quantum ESPRESSO.
Opens the Spectrum Plot panel.
Rotate the Workspace structure about the Y (vertical) axis.

Calculate high-spin and low-spin states of transition metal complexes, exploring some or all of the possible states produced by the transition metal initial guess code. Calculations can also be done on organic molecules and on complexes with more than one transition metal.
Opens the Spin States panel

Splice a contiguous set of residues from a source protein into an aligned target protein, removing residues from the target protein to accommodate the new protein segment. The region around the join points is minimized but no other refinement of the spliced segment is done.
Opens the Protein Splicing panel.

Increment the number of stars assigned to the current entry in the Stars column of the Project Table. When the maximum number is reached, the next execution of this commands sets the number of stars to zero.

Start a MacroModel job based on a previously created command file.
Opens the Start panel.

Calculate ligand strain energy from the difference between a tightly constrained minimization and an unconstrained minimization on each ligand pose.
Opens the Strain Energy Calculation and Rescoring panel.

Calculate the stress on a system as a function of the von Mises strain, from a set of molecular dynamic simulations.
Opens the Stress Strain panel.

Display a plot of the stress vs the strain from a stress-strain calculation.
Opens the Stress Strain Viewer Properties panel.

Generate QSAR/QSPR models using multiple linear regression (MLR), partial least squares (PLS), or principal component analysis (PCA).
Opens the Build QSAR Model panel.

Perform principal component analysis of a set of descriptors and plot factors and loadings.
Opens the Factor Analysis panel.

Make predictions based on a Strike QSAR/QSPR model.
Opens the Predict Based on QSAR Model panel.

Compute molecular similarities using distance-based similarity measures in descriptor space or in 2D-structure space with an atom-pair approach.
Opens the Calculate Similarity panel.

Display univariate and bivariate statistics for descriptors in the Project Table.
Opens the Univariate and Bivariate Statistics panel.

Align proteins to a reference protein structure as rigid bodies, making use of secondary structure information. The reference structure is the first included protein in the Project Table.
Opens the Protein Structure Alignment panel.

Read structures from a structure file in one format, and write them out to another file in another format. The allowed formats are: Maestro, PDB, SD, SMILES, MOL2, and CIF, with any of the usual file extensions.
Opens the Structure File Converter panel.

Calculate structure factors for a specified set of atoms from the structure in the Workspace.
Opens the Structure Factor Calculation panel.

Plot 1D and 2D structure factors from a structure factor calculation.
Opens the Structure Factor Viewer panel.

Transform (morph) a structure with identical atoms from one conformation to another using an unphysical path in torsion space, creating structures along this path.
Opens the Structure Morpher panel.

Build surfactant systems such as micelles, liposomes and bilayers from multiple surfactant molecules and solvent molecules.
Opens the Build Structured Liquid panel.

Perform rigid-body superposition of the structures that are included in the Workspace, or the structures that are selected in the Project Table, based on corresponding atom pairs defined by selection, ASL, or a SMARTS pattern.
Opens the Superposition panel.

Create slabs from a bulk structure and compute the surface energy.
Opens the Surface Energy Calculations Panel.

Calculate the surface tension of single phase systems from MD simulations.
Opens the Surface Tension Calculation Panel.

Plot the results of a surface tension calculation.
Opens the Surface Tension Viewer Panel.
Remove all surfaces from the Workspace.

Generate a surface for the selected atoms, with controls for the parameters of the surface.
Opens the Advanced Surfaces panel.

Calculate the electrostatic potential on a grid, using a Poisson-Boltzmann solver with the partial charges of the input structure, and generate isosurfaces and a mapping to the molecular surface.
Opens the Electrostatic Potential Surface panel.

Build a slab of a specified thickness by slicing a crystal structure along a specified plane, and optionally add a second slab above or below the first, taken from another crystal structure. Multiple slabs can be generated that are sliced along different planes.
Opens the Build Slabs and Interfaces panel.

Generate a surface for a set of atoms that consists of the outer surface of the atomic spheres whose radii are the van der Waals radii of the atoms.
Opens the VDW Surface panel.

Calculate tilt and rotational angles of surfactants from an MD simulation.
Opens the Surfactant Tilt Calculation Panel.

Show time series and histogram plots of tilt and rotational angles of surfactants.
Opens the Surfactant Tilt Viewer Panel.

Replace a selected fragment in each of a set of reference structures with a selected fragment from another structure. The structures are aligned by superposition before replacement is done.
Opens the Swap Fragments panel.

Impose point-group symmetry on the atoms in the Workspace.
Opens the Symmetrize Workspace dialog box.

Set up a system for molecular dynamics simulations. The system can include proteins, ligands, explicit solvent, a membrane, and counter ions.
Opens the System Builder panel.
macromodel_current_energy

Manage the hypotheses that are available to the project. This includes, creating, editing, and deleting hypotheses, importing and exporting hypotheses, and adding excluded volumes to hypotheses.
Opens the Manage Pharmacophore Hypotheses panel.

Load data from a Thermophysical Properties run so that it can be analyzed.
Opens the Load Tg Data panel.

Calculate thermal conductivity using reverse nonequilibrium MD simulations.
Opens the Thermal Conductivity Calculation Panel.

Plot the results of a thermal conductivity calculation, perform fitting to obtain a temperature gradient value and calculate the thermal conductivity.
Opens the Thermal Conductivity Viewer Panel.

Display plots of energy or thermodynamic properties as a function of temperature or pressure.
Opens the Thermochemistry Viewer Panel.

Calculate the density of a model system as a function of temperature using MD simulations, to generate data for evaluation of the coefficient of thermal expansion and the glass transition temperature (Tg).
Opens the Thermophysical Properties panel.

Analyze the density of a solid as a function of temperature to determine the coefficient of thermal expansion and the glass transition temperature. The densities are obtained from MD simulations at a set of temperatures in the NPT ensemble, and the uncertainties in the results due to the simulations can also be estimated.
Opens the Thermophysical Properties Analysis panel.
Switch the bonding style for eta-bonded organometallic complexes between a set of zero-order bonds to each eta-bonded atom and a one bond to the centroid of these atoms.
Open the Toggle Table panel, which provides PyMOL-like interaction with the Workspace.

Clean up the geometry of the Workspace structure by minimizing its energy. By default the OPLS_2005 force field is used. If this does not include the atoms you need to minimize, you can set a preference to use the UFF force field, which covers a wider range of atoms but is slower.
Reset the view in each tile to the initial view.
Tile the Workspace so that each entry occupies a separate tile, except for fixed entries, which are displayed in every tile.
Tile the Workspace so that all entries that are in the same entry group are displayed in the same tile.

Tile the Workspace so that each surface that is displayed in the Workspace is placed in a separate tile, along with the corresponding structure. Surfaces for fixed entries are displayed in every tile, and entries that are displayed in the Workspace that do not have surfaces are displayed in their own tiles, at the end of the grid.
Move tiles to a different location in the grid. Click on the tile you want to move, then click on the desired new location.
Transform all tiles simultaneously when rotating or translating. If this option is cleared, only the selected tile is transformed. Rotations and translations must start with the pointer in the tile.
Set the appearance of Workspace objects to the Aluminum style, which is a combination of lighting effects.
Set the appearance of Workspace objects to the default style, which is a combination of lighting effects.
Set the appearance of Workspace objects to the Dramatic style, which is a combination of lighting effects.
Set the appearance of Workspace objects to the Gloss style, which is a combination of lighting effects.
Set the appearance of Workspace objects to the Sundown style, which is a combination of lighting effects.
Render Workspace objects with medium quality, to balance appearance with the performance when rotating or translating.
Render Workspace objects with lower quality, to optimize the performance when rotating or translating. This includes using a simplified representation for atoms, bonds, and ribbons where necessary.
Render Workspace objects with higher quality. The cost of rendering might affect performance when rotating or translating.
Reposition atoms by dragging, with adustment of nearby atoms in a short force-field minimization.

Analyze profiles of torsional angles specified by SMARTS patterns, for graphical display.
Opens the Torsion Profile Analysis Panel.

Display profiles of torsional angles as radial and histogram plots.
Opens the Torsion Profile Analysis Viewer Panel.

Perform hierarchical clustering on structures from a Desmond trajectory based on the RMSD matrix of a specified set of atoms.
Opens the RMSD Based Clustering of Frames from Desmond Trajectory panel.

Perform hierarchical clustering on structures from a Desmond trajectory based on the RMSD matrix of a specified set of atoms.
Opens the RMSD Based Clustering of Frames from Desmond Trajectory panel.

Generate density profiles and cross-sections from the frames of a trajectory that can be averaged over a range of the trajectory.
Opens the Trajectory Density Analysis Panel.

View 1D and 2D profiles of the averaged density from a trajectory, generated using the Trajectory Density Analysis Panel.
Opens the Trajectory Density Analysis Viewer Panel.

Calculate the charge density and the electrostatic potential of a planar interface or micelle from the frames of a trajectory.
Opens the Trajectory Electrostatic Potential Analysis Panel.

Plot the charge density and electrostatic potential from a trajectory analysis.
Opens the Trajectory Electrostatic Potential Analysis Viewer Panel.

Calculate the temperature-dependent rate constant of a reaction using transition state theory from the output of previous quantum mechanical calculations on the reactants and the transition state.
Opens the TST Rate Calculation panel.

Plot the results of a TST Rate calculation.
Opens the TST Rate Viewer Panel.
Display 2D structures for Project Table entries in a rectangular grid, and use them to select and include structures. Opens the 2D Viewer panel.

Perform MD sampling of a structure in a set of windows along a path perpendicular to a substrate.
Opens the Umbrella Sampling Calculation (Beta) Panel.

View the free energy curve as a function of the collective variable from an umbrella sampling calculation.
Opens the Umbrella Sampling Viewer Panel.

Calculate within-simulation uncertainty for multiple thermophysical property simulations.
Opens the Uncertainty Quantification panel

Plot within-simulation and between-simulation uncertainties from an uncertainty quantification calculation.
Opens the Uncertainty Quantification Viewer panel
Change the coordinates of the entries in the Workspace to the coordinates of the current view.

Calculate the shear viscosity from multiple equilibrium MD simulations with averaging and curve fitting to obtain the viscosity value.
Opens the Shear Viscosity panel

Plot the results of a shear viscosity calculation and perform fitting to obtain a shear viscosity value.
Opens the Shear Viscosity Viewer panel

Display hydrogen bonds to the selected atoms, and label them with distances and donor-acceptor angle.
Opens the Visualize H-bonds panel.

Visualize restraints set on atom positions, bonds, angles, and dihedrals.
Opens the Visualize Restraints Panel.

Display transition moments from TDDFT calculations in the Workspace for a selected project entry.
Opens the Visualize Transition Moment panel.

Cluster structures based on their volume overlap, as calculated by the Phase utility phase_volCalc.
Opens the Clustering Based on Volume Overlap panel.

Screen ligands against one or more targets. The workflow includes ligand preparation, filtering based on properties, grid generation, and up to three docking stages, progressing from HTVS to SP to XP docking.
Opens the Virtual Screening Workflow panel.

Examine WaterMap simulation results, the enthalpy and entropy of individual water sites in the ligand binding sites of proteins relative to bulk water derived from the simulation, and visualize these sites (and their thermodynamic properties) in the Workspace, in relation to the protein and ligands.
Opens the WaterMap - Examine Results panel.

Estimate the excess enthalpy, entropy, and free energy of water molecules in the ligand binding site of a receptor, using molecular dynamics simulations.
Opens the WaterMap - Perform Calculation panel.
Place panels in a cascade from the top left towards the bottom right of the screen, in order of opening.
Close all open windows.
Raise all open panels to the top layer of your desktop.
Reopen all panels that have been opened in the Maestro session and closed.
Restore the panels to the locations and sizes that were last saved.
Save the current sizes and locations of the panels that have been opened in the current Maestro session.
Decrease the size of all Workspace fonts  (atom labels, measurements, adjustments, properties, captions, highlights).
Increase the size of all Workspace fonts (atom labels, measurements, adjustments, properties, captions, highlights).
Open the Preferences panel at the Workspace – Fonts section.
Add hydrogens where the valency of the nonhydrogen atoms in the selection is not satisfied.

Display molecular surfaces for the binding site of a receptor and the ligands in the site.
Opens the Create Binding Site Surfaces dialog box.

Change atom and residue properties for the selected atoms or the Workspace.
Opens the Change Atom Properties panel.
Choose the style preset to be applied when styling atoms. Same as clicking the Presets button arrow on the main toolbar.
Configure the Workspace display, layout, and tools. Same as clicking the Workspace Configuration button on the lower toolbar.

Edit the custom style preset, to define a style.
Opens the Edit Custom Preset dialog box.
Invert the chirality of the stereocenters in the selected atoms.
Align the structures in the Workspace by superposition. All atoms are used to superimpose so the structures should be conformers.
Create a molecular surface for the selected atoms.

Perform a rotation around a selected bond. The smaller part of the structure attached to the bond is rotated.
Opens the Dihedral Rotations banner.
Show nonbonded interactions in the Workspace, such as hydrogen bonds (H-bonds), pi interactions, and contacts.
Apply a style to the selected atoms, or to all atoms if none are selected. Same as clicking the Style button on the main toolbar.

View a table of the measurements made in the Workspace. Same as right-clicking the Measurements button on the lower toolbar.
Opens the Measurements panel.

Predict the crystal shape from the energies of its surfaces with the Wulff construction method.
Opens the Wulff Viewer Panel.

Run Glide docking jobs in which multiple ligand sets are docked to multiple receptors (cross-docking).
Opens the XGlide panel.

Visualize Glide XP scoring terms to understand protein-ligand interactions.
Opens the Glide — XP Visualizer panel.
